version_description:
We’ve been busy making improvements to live playback - you can now restart live programmes to ensure you never miss a moment. Let us know what you think!

Anything we've missed? Let us know @bbciplayer on Twitter or facebook.com/bbciplayer

We’ve been busy making improvements to live playback - you can now restart live programmes to ensure you never miss a moment. Let us know what you think!

Anything we've missed? Let us know @bbciplayer on Twitter or facebook.com/bbciplayer

This update introduces improved stability and a richer experience for users of Chromecast.
Anything we've missed? Let us know @bbciplayer on Twitter or facebook.com/bbciplayer

We’ve made it easier to watch more of your favourite BBC programmes.
Captivated by Taboo or Apple Tree Yard? Sit back and the next episode will start without you needing to do a thing.

Anything we've missed? Let us know @bbciplayer on Twitter or facebook.com/bbciplayer

We’ve made it easier to watch more of your favourite BBC programmes.
Captivated by Taboo or Apple Tree Yard? Sit back and the next episode will start without you needing to do a thing.

Anything we've missed? Let us know @bbciplayer on Twitter or facebook.com/bbciplayer

We’ve addressed a major crash, fixed a number of bugs and removed the audio from the start-up sequence.
Having issues with downloads? The BBC iPlayer team are looking into this so do keep an eye out for updates.
Thanks for your feedback, keep it coming and we'll continue to improve the app so that you can enjoy your favourite BBC programmes.

Anything we've missed? Let us know @bbciplayer on Twitter or facebook.com/bbciplayer

Thanks for letting us know about issues with downloads. We have made some improvements and continue to work on reducing failures.

In addition, we’ve been busy making iPlayer more personal and relevant to you. We will prompt you to sign in to your BBC account to discover My Channel.

Let us know what you think!

Anything we've missed? Let us know @bbciplayer on Twitter or facebook.com/bbciplayer

This update introduces support for the new Apple TV app, available to users with devices running iOS 11.2 and above.

Thank you for continuing to let us know about the issues some of you are experiencing with downloading programmes. We are continuing to work on reducing download failures with further updates coming soon.

Thoughts, feedback and general chat @bbciplayer on Twitter or facebook.com/bbciplayer

We've made some important changes to our Privacy and Cookies Policy and we want you to know what this means for you and your data. Find out more at https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/your-data-matters

This release contains assorted bug fixes and small enhancements designed to make using the app a better experience. These include:

- some images should now load faster
- fixed an issue where it was sometimes not possible to see channel logo in images
- changes to the way voice over speaks certain elements of the app

Thoughts and feedback welcome @bbciplayer on Twitter or facebook.com/bbciplayer

We've made some important changes to our Privacy and Cookies Policy and we want you to know what this means for you and your data. Find out more at https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/your-data-matters

BBC iPlayer now offers improved support for larger iPhone and iPad screen sizes. Whatever your device, you can continue to enjoy Dynasties, Doctor Who and more on your iPhone, iPad or iPod touch with iOS 9.3 or above.

BBC iPlayer now offers improved support for larger iPhone and iPad screen sizes. Whatever your device, you can continue to enjoy Dynasties, Doctor Who and more on your iPhone, iPad or iPod touch with iOS 9.3 or above.
We’re always looking for ways to make the iPlayer app better. We’ve been making improvements and fixing bugs so you can continue to enjoy your favourite shows.

We’ve been fixing bugs and listening to your feedback, so you can continue to watch and download your favourite shows when you're out and about, on 4G. No more Wi-Fi needed!

We’re always looking for ways to make the iPlayer app better. We’ve made improvements to Channels and Categories, making it easier to find your favourite shows and discover something new.

Thank you for updating iPlayer. We’ve been making improvements so you can continue to enjoy your favourite shows whether you’re at home or on the go.

Thank you for updating iPlayer. We’ve been making improvements so you can continue to enjoy your favourite shows whether you’re at home or on the go.

  In particular, we have fixed these bugs:
• Not all episodes would appear when viewing the A-Z pages for categories
• The wrong version would sometimes play when selecting a programme from the Audio Described or the Signed Language categories

Thank you for updating iPlayer. We’ve been making improvements so you can continue to enjoy your favourite shows whether you’re at home or on the go.

  In particular, we have fixed these bugs:
• Not all episodes would appear when viewing the A-Z pages for categories
• The wrong version would sometimes play when selecting a programme from the Audio Described or the Signed Language categories

We’re always looking for ways to make the iPlayer app better, so that you can continue to enjoy your favourite shows.

We’ve been working hard to:

- Enable you to use the iPlayer app when multitasking in Split View on iPad (compatible devices and OS versions only)
- Make improvements to the episode information page
- Fix some bugs seen when your phone is in dark mode
